column87: 1.:Please write at least 5 and up to 10 Characteristic statements in the spaces provided below.  Characteristics: The central attributes of our organization; what makes our organization distinctive and therefore unique from other organizations; and what is perceived by our employees to be enduring or continuing, regardless of objective changes in the organizational environment.     Examples of Characteristics: innovative, competitive, industry leader, customer centered, unique solutions, flexibility, responsiveness and holistic services.

column97: 1.:Please list at least 5 and up to 10 Purpose Statements in the spaces provided below.  Purpose Statements:    A shared sense of purpose is the glue that binds people together in common causes and often links individuals. Purpose statements answer the questions: Why do we exist? What needs do we fill? Why do we do what we do?    Examples of Purpose Statements: provide value to all stakeholders, being a good partner as opposed to just a financing solution, challenge the status quo, develop innovative products and services, offer the most cost effective solutions, offer the most flexible solutions and support our community.

column128: Better communication. There are often decisions that are made without the entire organization knowing or understanding the reasoning behind decisions. Leaders also tends to have differing views on decisions that are made, so lower staff is left to determine how to navigate the differences and how to communicate effectively based on which leader they are talking to. Decisions often don't align with current "investment themes" and it is difficult to stay current on emerging trends/themes when they are not communicated to the organization as a whole. "Investment themes" are the closest thing we have to a vision statement, strategic pillars, etc. So when these seem to be in constant flux, it makes it difficult to do jobs well.
column129: Whenever leadership partakes in culture events. Leaders (whether they know it or not) have a strong influence on the attitude and energy in the office. Their presence and participation is critical in establishing a culture and it often is not prioritized. When they show that their team is prioritized, it is felt.

column129: I come in to work. I work hard and feel appreciated. I feel valued. I connect and talk with my coworkers. I have a great team lunch. I have the flexibility to take care of my health. I work a bit late because I feel purpose. I have the opportunity to either go home and focus on my personal life... Or, based on the platform/tools that are available at MErcury Fund, I go out and represent the Fund and myself; and grow my personal and professional network.
